article.description: Matt Quinn scored 13 points as Bucknell coasted to a 75-25 victory over Army on Sunday.
article.headline: 48 total points in two losses to Bucknell
article.linkText: Black day for Knights: Army scores just 25
article.story: LEWISBURG, Pa. (AP) -- Matt Quinn scored 13 points as Bucknell coasted to a 75-25 victory over Army on Sunday. The 50-point margin of victory was the largest in Bucknell men's basketball history, surpassing a 102-53 win over Franklin & Marshall on Jan. 11, 1969. Bucknell (13-12, 9-3 Patriot League) placed 10 players in the scoring column in the first half as the Bison built a 41-9 halftime lead. Army (6-18, 3-9) was led by Travis Owsley's eight points. The two teams traded buckets to open the game, but Bucknell went on a 22-2 run over the next 12 minutes to put it away. Only two 3-pointers by Owsley in the final 1:06 prevented Army from setting the NCAA record for fewest points in a game in the shot-clock era. The record is held by Georgia Southern, which scored 21 points in a 1997 loss to Coastal Carolina. Bucknell beat Army 56-23 on Jan. 23. Bucknell, winners of seven straight, are undefeated at home in Patriot League play this season.
